Correlation Table with Confidence Intervals

Source: R/modeling.R
correlation_table.Rd

Calculate correlations between multiple variables with confidence intervals. Uses correlation package for comprehensive output.

Usage

correlation_table(
  data,
  vars,
  method = c("pearson", "spearman", "kendall"),
  adjust = c("none", "bonferroni", "holm", "fdr"),
  ci_level = 0.95
)

Arguments

data

Data frame

vars

Character vector of variable names to correlate

method

Character. Correlation method: "pearson" (default), "spearman", "kendall"

adjust

Character. Multiple comparison adjustment: "none" (default), "bonferroni", "holm", "fdr"

ci_level

Numeric. Confidence level (default 0.95)

Value

A tibble with correlations including:

  • Variable pairs

  • Correlation coefficient

  • Confidence interval

  • P-value (adjusted if requested)

  • Sample size

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
df <- data.frame(
  satisfaction = rnorm(100),
  loyalty = rnorm(100),
  value = rnorm(100)
)

cors <- correlation_table(df, c("satisfaction", "loyalty", "value"))
print(cors)
} # }
